#summary About Eclipse on how it is used with WebGIS Public

[http://www.eclipse.org/ Eclipse] is a development IDE that can be used for all kinds of stuff.

An eclipse project is controlled by the .project file which can be found in the root of the WebGIS Public source code trunk.

Eclipse has plugins for using subversion so that the project can be directly checked out into Eclipse which is recommended.

The tool Ant is integrated in Eclipse and is used for building. In the WebGIS source code building scripts for deplying debugging versions to a web server and to build a release version of the library.

Note that build scripts assume that they are run in the root of the project. To use the build scripts look into how to configure "Builders" in Eclipse.
